articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Ukraine's air force said on Saturday Russia launched a total of 67 long-range Shahed drones in a mass overnight attack, 58 of which it was able to shoot down.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russia launched 67 drones in overnight attack

articles.author: Rich Mckay
articles.description: Suspected Georgia high school shooter Colt Gray was set on Friday to appear in state court where he faces murder charges stemming from Wednesday's rampage that killed four people and wounded nine others.
articles.title: Teen suspected in Georgia school shooting to appear in court

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: A New York judge on Friday delayed former U.S. President Donald Trump's sentencing on charges stemming from hush money paid to a porn star until after the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Judge delays Trump hush money sentencing until after election

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: Stocked with extra food and supplies, they will return on a SpaceX vehicle in February 2025.
articles.title: Without astronauts, Boeing's Starliner returns to Earth

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Super Typhoon Yagi, Asia's most powerful storm this year, churned towards the northern coast of Vietnam on Saturday after tearing through China's southern island province of Hainan with lightning, rain and violent winds.
articles.title: Super Typhoon Yagi sets sight on Vietnam after tearing through China's Hainan

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: Thousands of people took to the streets across France on Saturday to protest President Emmanuel Macron's decision to appoint centre-right Michel Barnier as prime minister with left-wing parties accusing him of stealing legislative elections.
articles.title: Thousands protest in France after Macron picks Barnier as prime minister

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump heads to Wisconsin, a battleground state that could decide the election, for a rally on Saturday as he tries to solidify support in a key part of his support base: working-class and rural whites.
articles.title: Donald Trump looks to excite white, small-town base at Wisconsin rally

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Saturday her government has not been weakened by a controversy over a consultancy role offered to the former lover of a minister who resigned after a tearful televised apology to his wife.
articles.title: Meloni defends government after Italian culture minister quits over scandal

articles.author: Duncan Miriri, Laurie Chen
articles.description: China stopped short of providing the debt relief sought by many African countries this week, but pledged 360 billion yuan ($50.7 billion) over three years in credit lines and investments.
articles.title: China stops short of Africa debt relief as pledges more cash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kosovo said on Saturday it had closed two border crossings with Serbia after protesters on Serbian soil partially blocked roads and turned back passengers with Kosovo documents in protest over recent tensions in Kosovo's volatile north.
articles.title: Kosovo closes two border crossings with Serbia after protest
